about: I am a passionate higher education professional with a unique background of nonprofit service, leadership development, and logistical know-how. I love executing on team strategy and thrive on getting things done. I moved to the Boston area in 2009 and worked in area nonprofits for five years before returning to graduate school full time in 2014 to hone my leadership skills and gain experience in the higher education sector. Upon graduation in 2016, my journey led to MIT Sloan where I blend my nonprofit expertise, leadership training, and commitment to experiential education into my work with executive students earning their MBA degree. My CliftonStrengths top five are: Maximizer, Communication, Activator, Arranger, Developer

My current role meshes my background in leadership and student development with the logistics of serving two full-time executive degree earning student populations. I serve as a primary curriculum manager for the Sloan Fellows MBA & the Executive MBA students at MIT Sloan School of Management. My responsibilities include coordinating complex internal and external processes regarding programmatic logistics and curriculum delivery for both of our executive degree programs, managing course materials, and serving as a student advisor for Executive MBA students. I enjoy thoughtfully engaging with our partners and colleagues across Sloan to best serve our student population. 

With our colleagues in Sloan Technology Services, I piloted the implementation of the new Canvas Learning Management System for all Executive MBA courses. Consequently, I now represent the Executive Degree Program Office on the school-wide Canvas LMS Governance Committee. I am also pleased to serve as a resource to faculty, TA's, and administrators of the Canvas LMS platform. 

My favorite part of my job is managing the week-long capstone educational module, Leading With Impact. This final course for Executive MBA students integrates my passion for service with my passion for education. Students help local nonprofits address organizational challenges over 5 days. The results have been spectacular and I am so proud to be a part of the success of the module.

name: Lawrence Schmidt
about: I joined the MIT Sloan School of Management in 2018 as an Assistant Professor of Finance. My research is at the intersection of finance and macroeconomics. I use a unique combination of theory and applied econometrics to offer a richer picture of risks faced by financial market participants—households, institutional investors, and financial intermediaries—and shed new light on underlying economic mechanisms linking financial markets with the real economy. I am particularly interested in understanding factors which are associated with the risk and return to investments in human capital (that is, the present discounted value of labor income), and how frictions that limit risk sharing in the labor market affect asset prices and macroeconomic dynamics. In addition to studying the risk factors and behavior of households, I have also studied the behavior of institutional investors during financial crises. Prior to joining MIT, I was an Assistant Professor of Economics at the University of Chicago. I received my Ph.D and M.A. in Economics from the University of California, San Diego and my B.A. in Economics-Mathematics from the University of California, Santa Barbara.

name: Kelly Becker
about: Kelly is driven by innovation and the entrepreneurial spirit. She has been a leader within one of the world's most valuable startups, collaborated with CEOs and CTOs, and coached entrepreneurs who have appeared on ABC’s Shark Tank and the Forbes 30 Under 30 list. In 2021, Kelly appeared on Good Morning America (GMA) in a segment that featured Ladies Get Paid. Kelly is an experienced public speaker, has moderated panels, judged startup competitions, and been quoted by publications such as SportTechie and AudiPro. She has been a content creator for Career Contessa and the world's most recognized lacrosse player, Paul Rabil. Kelly is an NCAA National Champion field hockey player. She is a passionate life-long learner, having earned two Masters degrees while working full-time. Her superpower is that she is adaptable, and navigates ambiguity with confidence. She attributes this to having grown up across the country in a career military family.
